headline: We must hold Ohio officials accountable
sentences: I witnessed appalling obstruction of justice tactics by some of the members to ensure they would be able to take this issue to Federal court where they think they have a better chance of getting a gerrymandered map approved.

DEAR EDITOR:
I watched most of the March 28 Ohio Redistricting Commission’s meeting to finalize non-gerrymandered Ohio constitutional maps due by midnight per the Ohio Supreme Court’s order.

– Auditor Keith Faber -R-OH, 614-466-4514
– State Rep. Allison Russo -D-OH, 614-466-8012 A call is warranted for her stellar representation of the Ohio Constitution and its citizens.

– State Sen. Vernon Sykes -D-OH, Co-Chair of the Commission, 614-466-7041
ROBIN COX
Cincinnati
NEWSLETTER
Today's breaking news and more in your inbox

– State Sen. Matt Huffman, R-OH, 614-466-7584
– Frank LaRose, Secretary of State, R-OH, 330-349-2764
– Rep. Robert Cupp, R-OH, 614-466-9624
– Gov.
Ohio Attorney General Yost’s office tells me that we, the voters, are the only ones that can hold these politicians accountable by our votes.
I also witnessed stellar behavior by State Representative C. Allison Russo Ohio-D, District 24, a politician with a steel spine.
Call to demand they deliver fair legislative maps per the Ohio Constitution regardless of what court they end up in.
I suggest that we Ohioans take action right now and call their offices.
Call to thank them for supporting Ohio’s Constitution and voters.
Contempt of court order offenders’ phone numbers.
